item.title: Fencing and garden debris in park, 2nd July
item.description:
Recently, new trellis has been fitted to a local property which has a garden (and wall) that backs onto the park in Beechwood Crescent. The old trellis as well as garden debris has been dumped on the park side of the garden wall.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beechwood Crescent, Welling, London

item.description:

item.title: Household furniture dumped, 2nd July
item.description:
Witnessed the landlord leaving it all there over a week ago, spoke with him today and said it’s being picked up but he’s promised this for over a week now and it’s blocking access to a property garden. Belongs to number 1 West Heath road. But is dumped on amberley road as that’s where the alley comes out behind his property.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Amberley Road, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish blocking street, 2nd July
item.description:
Rubbish still not removed , this is on a well used busy street with school near by and children walking . Please removed the cardboard and bags of rubbish piled outside as this causing rats / smell and blocking the path for buggy’s / wheelchair and the children going to school . Not sure why you are not removing this rubbish

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 232, Plumstead High Street, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 31 Kentish Town Road, NW1 8NL, 2nd July
item.description:
Roadworks were carried out a while ago but these bollards have been here for over a month and is obstructing our deliveries. When will they be removed please?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, Kentish Town Road, Kentish Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 79 Brondesbury Villas, 2nd July
item.description:
The occupant of the lower ground floor flat A reported possible Japanese knotweed infestation to the rear garden. An inspection of the right-hand side of the rear garden room revealed a weed growth (the suspected Japanese knotweed), which when inspected was revealed to be a small tree growth and not Japanese Knotweed. This will need to be grubbed out and removed before it grows any larger and causes damage to the adjoining fence and garden room A wider inspection of the garden revealed extensive Japanese knotweed growth to the rear of the garden (behind the garden room) along the boundary with the railway line. This appeared to be wholly on the railway side of the boundary. This was apparent to be Japanese knotweed by the distinctive dead winter shoots, staggered/zigzag stems, and the hollow and brittle core of the shoots

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brondesbury Villas, London
Report on FixMyStreet
